subject: Add/get IPMI session IDs to Redfish
commitMessage:
Add/get IPMI session IDs to Redfish

As per existing implementation, Redfish supports to get only sessions
created on Redfish & EWS. But as per Redfish schema Redfish should
include to get IPMI sessions as well.
So add support to display IPMI session Id's as well on Redfish.
This commit will not impact any functionality/behavior of existing code.
Below functionalities implemented in this commit.
1. Get IPMI session collection
2. Get individual IPMI session information
3. Delete IPMI sessions - Respond with not supported as we can't delete
   IPMI sessions from Redfish interface

Tested:
1. Verified redfish validator passed with active IPMI session.
2. Get session details from Redfish
GET: https://<BMC-IP>/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions
Response:
{
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/",
    "@odata.type": "#SessionCollection.SessionCollection",
    "Description": "Session Collection",
    "Members": [
        {
            "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/TlFPbR9ZIn"
        },
        {
            "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/184U3014ub"
        },
        {
            "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/cV0xi5QoPy"
        },
        {
            "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/8f6234d7_81"
        }
    ],
    "Members@odata.count": 4,
    "Name": "Session Collection"
}

3. Get session details from RedFish
Case 1: RedFish session
GET: https://<BMC-IP>/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/TlFPbR9ZIn
Response:
{
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/TlFPbR9ZIn",
    "@odata.type": "#Session.v1_3_0.Session",
    "ClientOriginIPAddress": "::ffff:10.xx.xx.xx",
    "Description": "Manager User Session",
    "Id": "TlFPbR9ZIn",
    "Name": "User Session",
    "UserName": "root"
}
Case 2: IPMI session
Verified and displayed IPMI session details on RedFish.
GET: https://<BMC-IP>/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/8f6234d7_81
Response:
{
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/8f6234d7_81",
    "@odata.type": "#Session.v1_3_0.Session",
    "ClientOriginIPAddress": "xx.xx.xx.xx",
    "Description": "Manager User Session",
    "Id": "8f6234d7_81",
    "Name": "User Session",
    "UserName": "root"
}
4. Delete IPMI session:
Verified IPMI session is not allowed to delete from Redfish
DELETE: https://<BMC-IP>/redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions/8f6234d7_81
Response:
{
    "error": {
        "@Message.ExtendedInfo": [
            {
                "@odata.type": "#Message.v1_1_1.Message",
                "Message": "The action deleting IPMI session from
                            Redfish is not supported by the resource.",
                "MessageArgs": [
                    "deleting IPMI session from Redfish"
                ],
                "MessageId": "Base.1.8.1.ActionNotSupported",
                "MessageSeverity": "Critical",
                "Resolution": "The action supplied cannot be resubmitted
                to the implementation.  Perhaps the action was invalid,
                the wrong resource was the target or the implementation
                documentation may be of assistance."
            }
        ],
        "code": "Base.1.8.1.ActionNotSupported",
        "message": "The action deleting IPMI session from Redfish is not
                    supported by the resource."
    }
}
5. Delete RedFish session
Result: successfully deleted valid RedFish session.

Signed-off-by: Jayaprakash Mutyala <mutyalax.jayaprakash@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ia994fa9c4de09e66655895b687aa6a89f4deb942

Abandoned

It's been 3 months since the last response from the submitter, this patch appears to be abandoned.  Feel free to reopen if this is still desired to be merged to master.

Much more than a 1 sentence description is needed here.

1. Why are we mixing protocols?
2. For those that don't use IPMI, how does one disable this behavior?
3. Is POST, and DELETE implemented, or just get?

1. Based latest Redfish schema, Redfish should include to display IPMI session Id's as well. So implementation is done as part of this patch.
Schema: https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Session_v1.xml

2. Here including Redfish and EWS sessions Id's will get IPMI sol sessions as well. Updated the API name.
3. Pushed another patch.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/#/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/37953/

> 1. Based latest Redfish schema, Redfish should include to display IPMI session Id's as well. So implementation is done as part of this patch.

Just because Redfish has a field for it doesn't mean that OpenBMC needs it.  What's your specific use case for wanting it?

> Schema: https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Session_v1.xml
> 
> 2. Here including Redfish and EWS sessions Id's

Just so you're aware, Redfish and EWS sessions are functionally the same thing internally.

> will get IPMI sol sessions as well. Updated the API name.

Did 2 get desyncronized?  It doesn't look like you answered the question.

> 3. Pushed another patch.
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/#/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/37953/

It should be noted.... I asked for this detail in the commit message.    You've added a little more..... lets try to get more of this captured there.
2. Functionality is not changed for Redfish/EWS. Only we have included code for adding IPMI sessions to display on Redfish.

I asked 3 questions, you answered one of them.  Please answer them in your commit message.

"Functionality is not changed for Redfish/EWS"
Considering you're editing redfish endpoints, I find this hard to reconcile with the code you pushed.

Done.

Thanks for the review comments. Added now in detailed commit message. Please let me know your comments.

1. This function not only handles IPMI sessions, it also gets redfish or EWS sessions, Could these two functions(IPMI session handling and redfish session handling) be separated? Now they are mixed together, maybe could be handled in parallel.
2. If they must be handled together for some reason, the function name should be more general, since it not only gets Ipmi session.
Now updated API name to generic. Thanks
how we are discarding session less entry ?Can u please explain
If "State" property value is no t zero on bus service, then collecting the IPMI session here.
Ed asked this and I don't see it answered here: "Just because Redfish has a field for it doesn't mean that OpenBMC needs it.  What's your specific use case for wanting it?"

Hi @Ed  & @Gunnar,

Reason for this change. 

IPMI is still used by many Data center management tools, even though Redfish adoption is in progress. In order to maintain the compatibility, and still rely on Redfish in terms of security. It is essential to query all active session of all interfaces through Redfish (not only Redfish, but IPMI etc.). Hence listing the IPMI sessions through Redfish session schema provides a way for management software monitoring to understand known / unknown sessions in the BMC and take suitable action from security point of it.

Hope this clarifies. Let me know if you have any other clarification, in terms of why.

You can use sdbusplus::asio::getProperty, it saves some lines of code and handles variant in a correct way. In case property is different type that uint8_t will produce default variand with 0u inside. sdbusplus::asio::getProperty will return variant with no type set and execute callback with error_code set instead
Done
Why create new asyncResp? There is one already passed in doGet parameter, also it shadows parameter name
Done

I still struggle with this. 
From https://redfish.dmtf.org/redfish/schema_index

Session - The Session Resource describes a single connection (session) between a client and a Redfish Service instance.

Where does Redfish say this?

The only reference to IPMI I see in sessions is: 

                "SessionType": {
                    "anyOf": [
                        {
                            "$ref": "#/definitions/SessionTypes"
                        },
                        {
                            "type": "null"
                        }
                    ],
                    "description": "The active session type.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall represent the type of session that is currently active.",
                    "readonly": true,
                    "versionAdded": "v1_2_0"
                },

        "SessionTypes": {
            "enum": [
                "HostConsole",
                "ManagerConsole",
                "IPMI",
                "KVMIP",
                "OEM",
                "Redfish",
                "VirtualMedia",
                "WebUI"
            ],
            "enumDescriptions": {
                "HostConsole": "The host's console, which could be connected through Telnet, SSH, or other protocol.",
                "IPMI": "Intelligent Platform Management Interface.",
                "KVMIP": "Keyboard-Video-Mouse over IP Session.",
                "ManagerConsole": "The manager's console, which could be connected through Telnet, SSH, SM CLP, or other protocol.",
                "OEM": "OEM Type.  For OEM session types, see the OemSessionType property.",
                "Redfish": "A Redfish session.",
                "VirtualMedia": "Virtual media.",
                "WebUI": "A non-Redfish web user interface session, such as a graphical interface or another web-based protocol."
            },

For what it's worth, I really don't like that we're grabbing an IPMI specific structure here.  This implies that we'll need separate interfaces for IPMI, Redfish, PLDM, dbus-rest, ect, and that would make this api very slow to have to poll all of those.

This can have potential issues let's say there is session 110 and you are looking for session 10. You may find incorrect session.

I don't know what session path looks like but I guess sdbusplus::message::object_path.filename() is a method you want to use here.
+1.  To the author: please read and understand COMMON_ERRORS.md.  This method is called out explicitly by name.
It's pointer you should not dereference it before checking if it's valid. Same issue can happen with remoteIpAddr.
